meanings.definition: relating to the study of the spread and control of diseases
meanings.sent1: The epidemiologic report highlighted the patterns of disease transmission in the community.
meanings.sent2: Researchers used epidemiologic data to track the outbreak of the virus.
meanings.sent3: The epidemiologic study revealed some surprising trends in illness distribution.
meanings.sent4: Her approach to solving the issue was as thorough as an epidemiologic investigation.
meanings.sent5: The importance of handwashing was emphasized in the epidemiologic training session.

meanings.definition: a branch of medicine that deals with the incidence, distribution, and control of diseases
meanings.sent1: The field of epidemiologic focuses on understanding how diseases spread.
meanings.sent2: An epidemiologic expert was consulted to analyze the outbreak data.
meanings.sent3: The epidemiologic department worked tirelessly to prevent the disease from spreading.
meanings.sent4: She considered the epidemiologic approach to be crucial in managing public health.
meanings.sent5: The impact of vaccines on population health is a key aspect of epidemiologic research.
